website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a less expensive option for waterproof paper, the Rite in the Rain brand does a good job.
pros: Works great as a paper for taking notes in the field, particularly in wet and muddy conditions
Runs through a laser printer or copier without problems
cons: This product is not as good as some other waterproof papers for working with alcohol-based inks

customer_reviews.title: Great Map Paper
customer_reviews.text: I printed out a map as soon as I got this paper and folded it, keeping it in my purse to see how well it holds up. It's held up great with that kind of wear. It's perfect for a camping trip off grid if you don't like to be solely dependent on your phone. I also spilled a few drops of water on it and no issues at all. I'm going hiking abroad this summer and wanted to print some maps of specific areas. The map pictured here is printed double sided and no bleed through. Great paper.
customer_reviews.author: Page

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We use these to make price tags for Christmas Trees. They get wet and pulled on all the time and we have never had a problem. It feels close to regular paper, a little waxy but almost impossible to identify if put next to regular printer paper. We print with a HP laser jet printer and the ink looks good and has never came off. Sometimes these will sit in the water for a few days and never come apart. We buy a few packs every year to make more labels. All of the benefits of regular paper, and all of the benefits of a laminated paper.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus

customer_reviews.title: This one works and it works great. I buy it every year
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. I use this paper for data collection in some research trials out in the field. 2017-09-22 I was riding our research lifter when it began to sprinkle on us. About 3 hours of light drizzle, constant dust/mud, and the paper still feeds through our scanner at the office (well, that requires taking the dust off....lol.) Worth. Every. Single. Cent. and then some. If you are looking at this product, you know you'll be in wet/muddy conditions where waterproof paper would be needed. This one works and it works great. I buy it every year.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Groen

customer_reviews.title: Paper that is good in the rain
customer_reviews.text: The first plan was to print some logs using my inkjet and laser printers. The paper worked well in the printers even though it is a slightly different weight than the standard paper. Ink seemed to work well without any problems and so I printed more logs of different sizes. The logs are now being signed in the field by geocachers and no complaints. Paper has a nice feel, good colour, cuts well and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: billfern

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper to make color copies of my passport. When out and about in a foreign country I carry this very durable and waterproof copy with me in case I need identification. The copies have held up well for weeks in my pocket in wet tropical climates. The paper is heavier than "normal" and has a slightly odd slippery feel but there was no trouble laser printing onto it and I have yet to have any of it die from being wet or repeatedly handled so it's durability is spectacular!
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Actually seems like normal paper
customer_reviews.text: This looks and feels like normal paper, but if you soak it, it just stays functional. Importantly, it can fold and crease like normal paper, and cuts normally, so you can use it for outdoor origami or whatever. If you soak it and crumple it and uncrumple it, you can tell it was crumpled, but it's easy to flatten out again. This product significantly exceeded my expectations. There's no tradeoff here other than price per page.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy (WA)

customer_reviews.title: Works like out is suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: I never use standard paper for a field book. I have used Rite in Rain field books before. This paper is just as good and has my specific form to fill in. I made field notebooks for use in logging drill core. I had my form laser-printed on the paper at the local print shop and had the shop bind it with spiral binding. The paper worked fine in spite of rain, high humidity, and sweaty hands.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Rite in the rain paper
customer_reviews.text: It’s paper. I haven’t been able to test the water resistance of the paper, but it feels like regular paper. We had issues printing on it, even with a laser jet printer. We couldn’t keep it from smearing and smudging. Apparently with waterproof paper you have to tinker with the heat settings until you get it right. We haven’t found that temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Rubemeyer

customer_reviews.title: this stuff is all that they say
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a printer service to print hiking maps on thick waterproof card stock. I wanted something easier to fold and unfold for orienteering. This paper is exactly what I needed. You can soak the stuff in water, dry it off, and you'd never know it had ever been wet. And it's 20 lb bond--just like plain paper. Easy to handle, perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: JemmyDucks

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but wrinkles?
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my color laser printer to print trail maps. It looks just like regular paper, but it is durable and weather proof. I have no worries about the map bleeding or being damaged if it gets wet. In this package, the paper came wrinkled. It doesn't affect the function, but it would have been nice for the paper to start out flat.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL D PEARCE

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for forms we use at the Lake District. We are often out adjusting the dams in rain and all sorts of weather and needed something to record our data that would not turn to mush in the rain or snow. This clearly fits the bill. It ran through the copier without problem and the results really are rainproof. The only thing to note is the paper is really stiff and is not meant for folding. Also you need a heavy duty punch if you intend to put it in a binder. But if you want something to hold up in the rain and snow I will highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Peder

customer_reviews.title: Awesome paper, a little thin
customer_reviews.text: Although a bit expensive, this paper was a great alternative to purchasing a blank rite in the rain notebook. I used the paper to create and print my own fishing journal and it worked flawlessly at home with my laser printer. It’s a little thin and I can barely see the outline of the printing when I print on both sides but it’s not enough to bother me. I would definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Windy Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS STUFF
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS STUFF!!! Bought this paper so I could make some geocaches. The paper takes copying really well and I even tested the paper by keeping a sheet out and letting it rain on it. I was impressed. Should work great for the logs and instructions in my caches...Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: B.S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Sure it's water proof, Mixed imprinted line
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of water proof paper but it needs to be thicker so it will not warp. Also this pad of paper I got had a crease in most all the sheets, an line imprint. I would not buy this paper from this company again. They mixed the paper good and bad. Crooked manufacture!!
customer_reviews.author: NomadFox

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a laser printer and in heavy dew
customer_reviews.text: Use this for astronomy stuff and it works well with running through a laser printer and then writing in horribly heavy dew with a rite in the rain pen. At the end of the night I hang the pages up with clothes pins in the laundry room and the next day they are ready to file.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard in the Air

customer_reviews.title: I found its limits
customer_reviews.text: RITR paper is very tough and rain-resistant, but it still has its limits. I enclosed some of it inside a Ziploc bag in a pants cargo pocket and forgot about it, then had to do a creek crossing in water, waist deep. A little bit of water leaked through the zipper on the bag without my immediately noticing it. When I found out later on, everything in my bag was a mess. The RITR paper was pretty disheveled too and a lot of the ink had begun to run. But I set it aside and let it air dry, and it was good to go, again.
customer_reviews.author: Texas BEAST

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I work for a real estate appraiser and we sketch houses - rain or shine. I've used this paper on 3 separate occasions, the last being today in a wintry mix of sleet, rain, and snow. I print a grid using a laser-jet printer and wow, it holds up as advertised and there is no issue whatsoever with writing/drawing. I haven't tried a pen - only pencil. The only "issue" is that once you've made a mark, it's almost impossible to erase. Overall, this product has been a life-saver as I've had sketches on conventional paper almost disintegrate during an inspection. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My husband asked for this paper because he's a nursery worker and is outside all day everyday regardless of the weather. He has quite a few things to keep track of and regular paper wasn't cutting it. He swears by this paper because if it gets a bit damp, it doesn't fall apart or run. A little spendy but it's so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Tough and durable
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. I am a fire captain and needed something to write reports on in every type of weather scenario so I decided to test this out. It will rip and fold like any regular piece of paper (which is not a drawback) but it is a little tougher. I poured some water on a sheet and let it sit for a few minutes. There was zero smearing of the ink and zero penitration into the paper. The water just beaded off. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I teach swim lessons and like to jot down notes about my swim kids. This paper is excellent! I only use pencil on it because it’s always splash-covered as I keep it poolside on a clipboard. I have notebooks and other material that turn into a squishy mess with ink running everywhere. This paper is pricey, but it does the job and allows me to make sure I’m doing right by my students!
customer_reviews.author: L. Bolin

customer_reviews.title: Writing Poetry in a storm
customer_reviews.text: This paper is amazing. Just use a pencil and you can write in a downpour. I bought a special space pen for $20 at rei and it’s okay. I'm gonna just use the trusty old pencil that my kids use for school. It probably cost a quarter. The pencil works way better.
customer_reviews.author: Trust Me, I Buy a Lot of Stuff!

customer_reviews.title: Not synthetic paper like Yupo. If that's what you want, look for something else.
customer_reviews.text: Evidently I bought the wrong paper. This is far from Yupo, a synthetic paper that this "waterproof paper" was being compared to. Not at all, absorbs like a sponge, unlike Yupo. I was looking for paper to use with alcohol inks, apparently, this isn't it. Perhaps it's great for doing other things, just not my purpose. On a side note, delivery was fast, purchase no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: McD

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to make lumber tags. When you go to Lowes in MS or LA you will likely see this product in use on their lumber. It holds up extremely well to the elements. I use a laser printer to print and it does not smudge or run when wet. I have even run this paper through our pressure treating process for our lumber without failure. Its a little pricey but I know it works.
customer_reviews.author: D Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected.
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for the first time. I print topo maps for canyoneering, they need to holdup to getting wet. After printing the map, the ink didn't show very well (very faint) and easily smeared. After letting it set for days, I licked my thumb and lightly ran it across a corner - a lot of ink came off the map. This is not a good product for my usage, unfortunately I didn't try it before the return date expired. : ( The waterproof paper I used previously from TOPO worked perfectly - bright and didn't run in water - don't make it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rite in the rain delivers again.
customer_reviews.text: Rite in the Rain anything is guaranteed to please. I purchased this for creating field datasheets and printing my fishing license. I printed the license on a regular laser printer. While fishing for two weeks in Montana, it moved between my creel and my shirt pocket. At the end of every day I just hung the soaked license up to dry and it was ready to go the next day. Ink never faded or ran.
customer_reviews.author: electricquad

customer_reviews.title: Great geocaching log paper
customer_reviews.text: Pricey paper, but it makes great logs for geocaches. Allows cachers to write on the logs in any weather. Try Geocaching if you haven't already!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn K. of Hoagies' Gifted Education Page

customer_reviews.title: a good answer to an old problem
customer_reviews.text: Something new for us. We print real estate flyers which stay in a plastic box outside the house. The boxes tend to leak and the paper gets wet and clumps together. That does not happen with this paper. It's not inexpensive, but worth the price. It saves throwing away wet flyers every week. A new answer to an old problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Samuelson

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. It's on the high side of what you'd expect the cost to be. It's well made and the description is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bjornson

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect, well almost perfect product
customer_reviews.text: In making first aid kits for my family I needed something that could stand up in inclement weather. This is the perfect, well almost perfect product. It would be perfect if it had graphing lines on it. But for my wants, it was good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Perri M. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for working in wet conditions in preventing the paper from breaking down. Combined with waterproof ink pen one can write notes in wet conditions that will not run and will be legible.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Weatherproof (LASER PRINTABLE!) Paper for Work Maps
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased Rite in the Rain notepads before and was impressed to see their copy paper is every bit as good. I had no trouble feeding this through my laser printer from the tray. The paper is not bright (and might have a slight yellowish tint) but worked well printing detailed maps for work. I recommend Rite in the Rain paper for applications where moisture, oil and dirt could jeopardize the use of your paper. I will definitely be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: OlympusRan

customer_reviews.title: Arrived open
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived open. The paper appeared possible damaged, I removed the front and back sheet. The back sheet was folded and unusable, the rest of the paper is usable. Still disappointing, for the price I wold expect the product to arrive in better condition. It's really not worth the trouble for a return at this point.
customer_reviews.author: ih8myx

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I order this paper for our business all the time and it works great! We are a stone company and have to label our pallets of stone when they are out on the yard. We use this paper with our logo (printed with a laserjet) and they sit out the elements and still look great. I've submerged the whole page before and the water just beads up. Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Strength

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PAPER
customer_reviews.text: This printer paper is amazing, specially for ARMY documents, like 9 line Med Evac, Range cards, platoon tracking and truck assignment, when the weather is cold and rainy. I will buy it again. SFC U.S. ARMY
customer_reviews.author: PEDRO A. REYESLOZADA

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper to make labels for my plants. Whenever water is splashed onto the paper, it just beads right off, which is great for my purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Dirty's printer
customer_reviews.text: These tend to leave trace remnants of something on my HP 7740. Every time I use them I have to end up using the printer cleaning apps to clean out the printer. Either tray.
customer_reviews.author: L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Very nice waterproof/resistant paper
customer_reviews.text: Very nice waterproof/resistant paper. Was not packaged the best. Paper is not well packaged in folding cardboard. This tends to leave some individual pieces of paper or up to 10 sheets or so crimped at the corners. Problematic as you can often forget about those going through a laser printer. Should be packaged more simply in plastic or paper. Would have given 5 stars otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: John Ruths

customer_reviews.title: Rite in the Rain Paper does what is says
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper when it's wet outside. The fibers don't separate when it gets wet. Works well with black and white laser printers but not inkjet printers (inkjet ink isn't waterproof anyway). You can write on it underwater if you are careful about it. Probably not recommended for scuba diving, but rain showers are just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Lakish

customer_reviews.title: The go to waterproof copier/notebook paper
customer_reviews.text: I have used this paper for the last 15 years. I know of no other source. Paper is of extremely high quality and rugged. The only negative is that it will only work with laser printers and thermal copiers.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Card

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great for custom maps and forms that are exposed to elements. A bit pricey for regular use though.
customer_reviews.author: Truffle Hound

customer_reviews.title: Water Proof Paper
customer_reviews.text: This paper makes recording test results while it is raining so much easier and more accurate than other paper.
customer_reviews.author: T K Pap

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: A must product if you work in the field. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Gabo

customer_reviews.title: Great product for printing your own outdoor forms
customer_reviews.text: Great product for printing your own outdoor forms. Their pocket size note pad is a must for me to have on a daily basis. Been using Rite in the Rain products for more than 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo del Lago

customer_reviews.title: Extremely economical
customer_reviews.text: This paper is very economical. It isn't as heavy or slick as the white paper but it is so much less costly. It doesn't get exposed to moisture that often so I feel it is the best option for my use. Since there was 200 sheets in the package, it should last a very long time before I need to replace. I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TNWoman

customer_reviews.title: Great paper for outside use
customer_reviews.text: good stuff. We have used this paper for years for our field forms. Works like a charm. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof paper, but can't erase on it.
customer_reviews.text: Worked creating during class when maintenance turned in the sprinklers while we were working. The only downside is that it's impossible to erase on this paper, I recommend keeping white out on you in case of mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Purchased for resin jewelry making and does the job nicely. Does not absorb resin or cloud during curing. Takes toner from my laser printer very well.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Good product, environmentally friendlier than plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely rain proof, but was hoping it would also be a little more tear proof, which it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paper is super tough, every bit as waterproof as they claim ...
customer_reviews.text: Paper is super tough, every bit as waterproof as they claim and feels like normal high quality paper. I use this loose leaf to make leather bound journals for adventure travel. I buy this product over and over again, and the paper lasts forever. Here is a link:
customer_reviews.author: Alison Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this for memoir. I want to be certain that the words I leave behind will stay weather proof from spills etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl the Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Great paper
customer_reviews.text: This actually really works. I had signs out for my church's free tag sale a few days ahead of time, and of course it rained. No smudging, no running of letters....great.
customer_reviews.author: Leo F.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected!
customer_reviews.text: This paper fed smoothly in our photocopier. The print resolution rendering was excellent even printed two-sided. The paper was water resistant in the field both in terms of toner adhesion and the tan color of the paper itself. It was also fairly abrasion resistant during field use. So I was completely pleased with this paper!
customer_reviews.author: R. Koning

customer_reviews.title: Nice waterproof paper
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my project. Product box arrived a little banged up, but the sheets were in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Geocaching log sheet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for geocaching log sheets. This is the best for damp areas. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in all kinds of weather
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for a landscape dedign student and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: weezie

customer_reviews.title: Used for printing cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Used to print a cookbook to sell to raise money for charity.
customer_reviews.author: LDTimm

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, printed forms to use in field, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: timothy w bradley

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: This paper fed smoothly in our photocopier. The print resolution rendering was excellent even printed two-sided. The paper was water resistant in the field both in terms of toner adhesion and stain resistance of the white color of the paper itself. It was also fairly abrasion resistant during field use. So I was completely pleased with this paper!
customer_reviews.author: R. Koning

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good stock, thick paper. No issues when it gets wet
customer_reviews.author: AVFranks

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I printed a template on to these using a HP LaserJet printer, then punched holes in them for a 3 ring binder, then spent a weekend in the rain and snow taking notes using a regular pencil. These held up great---no smears whatsoever, none of the pages fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Expected
customer_reviews.text: This paper fed smoothly in our photocopier. The print resolution rendering was excellent even printed two-sided. The paper was water resistant in the field both in terms of toner adhesion and the green color of the paper itself. It was also fairly abrasion resistant during field use. So I was completely pleased with this paper!
customer_reviews.author: R. Koning

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you're a field biologist, you need this paper. Make your own datasheets on a laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: flower

customer_reviews.title: good stuff and it works
customer_reviews.text: good stuff - works like it is supposed to. just dont' use an eraser on it.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie W. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great to be able to buy a large pack of these, so we don't run out so often.
customer_reviews.author: hhatcher

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: We've had problems with logbooks deteriorating over time because of the humidity and rain on our island. Now we create them using Rite in the Rain paper instead of regular copier paper and the logbooks are lasting much longer. You can even write on the paper if it's wet. Amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: William H. K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: a life saver
customer_reviews.text: Used this for small boat ocean field work. This paper literally saved my PhD thesis. Regular paper would not have held up. Once the clipboard fell overboard, just wiped the paper down with a paper towel and it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: alouise

customer_reviews.title: Great for printing hiking maps on for that rainy day out
customer_reviews.text: Effective on water resistance. Not particularly cheap but good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Howard J Mayson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Rite in the Rain paper is so great for printing maps to take on camping/hiking/fishing trips. So much more durable than regular paper and if you use a laser printer to print then the ink is more durable (water resistant) as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pig

customer_reviews.title: The very best WP paper you can get - tested and made in the NW.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for printing maps (laser printer only) to use in the NW woods.
customer_reviews.author: K DavisTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Laser printer ink flakes off after printing
customer_reviews.text: The paper has a nice quality feel to it, but the ink from the laser printer did not stick to the paper. I tried it on two different laser printers using the suggested settings on the package, and the ink flakes off of the page.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Just received, I used it to print out some online star maps. Initial test consisted of writing on a piece in ballpoint pen and then running under faucet water. Both paper and ink were not smeared or affected at all. Looks like a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Little T

customer_reviews.title: Worked GREAT in the rain - used it as copier paper ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked GREAT in the rain - used it as copier paper and superimposed graph paper image on it so I could measure out in the field in inclement weather, and it worked perfectly. A bit tough if you have to erase, but pencil wrote well. Wasn't as slick feeling as I thought it would be, but water balled up perfectly and just brushed off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at home too
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for printing recipes in the kitchen. Now we don't have to worry about getting a page wet.
customer_reviews.author: T&M

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: It is "All Weather Writing Paper". It is NOT water proof. I would say it's heavy duty water resistant. I printed out some color stuff on his paper with my laser printer and ran it under the faucet. No damage and no effect on the printing. If you want to write under water then don't bother with this. It is paper that has been treated and coated, so it will eventually fall apart. It will also rip just like regular paper. I use this for printing out my Family Communications Plan and maps. Because I also store these in waterproof pouches I do not require 100% water proof paper. So this paper works perfectly for me ESPECIALLY price wise.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D. Self

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for marine biology field work
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper all the time for marine biology field work! It prints nicely, and it works well with pencils and most pens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you use the appropriate pen
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is indispensable when you work in the field, but make sure you use a waterproof pen with it or it won't work well.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bird

customer_reviews.title: Plain copy paper with a waterproof coating: does what is says.
customer_reviews.text: Other waterproof paper products are more like Tyvek. Great for printing maps, nearly impossible to tear, etc. This product is more like regular copy paper but with a waterproof coating. It will run smoothly through your copier or laser printer (as long as it has a heated fuser). Don't try to use this in you color ink printer (most inks are water based and wont penetrate onto the paper). Also this paper will rip or tear like regular paper but it does repel water and will out last regular paper in humid or wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Victor N

customer_reviews.title: Printable, editable waterproof paper.
customer_reviews.text: Great product I have used for years. If you need forms you can get wet and still edit there is really no other option.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Fry

customer_reviews.title: This stuff was awesome. I used it to make personalized labels for ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was awesome. I used it to make personalized labels for water bottles and then put them in a cooler with ice and water. No bleeding at all. Everyone loved them. We will definitely use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about this earlier.
customer_reviews.text: These work great to print up a waterproof map of a small area. I also use there notebooks and a waterproof pen for winter hiking.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a fisher space pen in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: JWK

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't smear but wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: Beware, this paper still holds the ink without smearing after getting wet but wrinkles terribly.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Use this all the time and it's the best. Not too thin and easily erasable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: If you're making labels in wet conditions or mail things to places with typhoons and thunderstorms, these labels can't be beat. They will not fade or run.
customer_reviews.author: LEMOakland

customer_reviews.title: good paper to write underwater
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper to write underwater, it is very good, we can write over it with a pencil, and it is not easy to erase them. It is not so good if you want to re-used other time.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lancho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water resistant paper
customer_reviews.text: It's great! If you need water resistant paper - just a warning, it is not waterproof!!! It's a great option for field programs and maps, but don't expect it to hold out in super wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Rietta Hohman

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. We printed schedules on them for summer camp. The schedules made it all week.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for our purposes
customer_reviews.text: This paper is excellent and serves the exact purpose we are using it for, I wish they made this paper in heavier stock in the same sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Galinski

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill for geocaching logs!!
customer_reviews.text: This is just the paper needed for geocaching logs!! Helps when keeping the logs changed out in cache when the log is full or wet blobs of paper in the cache!! Keeps future cachers happy!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great...
customer_reviews.text: ...and the tan color color is perfect for may needs - much better than plain white when used in the field for forms that are practical and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike @ Cerebrum Shoppe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Paper works great! I used a regular printer and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: I would strongly recommend fanning the sheets according to the directions so they ...
customer_reviews.text: Paper fed and printed well. I was able to cut and bind a book with it. It feels a little different than regular paper. The book did not get significant water exposure so I cannot attest to it's waterfastness. I would strongly recommend fanning the sheets according to the directions so they don't stick together in the copier.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W.

customer_reviews.title: Rain Rite Paper
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! I use this paper when making sniper data log books for riflemen. I photo copy my information right to the Rain Rite paper using a copy machine. This works great & makes a decent looking data book.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. No

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this paper in the pouring rain and once it dries out you would never know it had been wet
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Please remember to use a laser printer, as inkjet printing will simply rinse off the type of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Jesus H. Christ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice experiment - going to use for my geocaching logs from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Heather B

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to print off a map to take backpacking. We dipped it in water for 10 mins and it looked as good as new!
customer_reviews.author: kl4568

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We are using this paper to print our own GeoCache log sheets and it stands up very well.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for mist
customer_reviews.text: does not hold any rigidity when wet. Might be good for mist. But not for wet conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer Matt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent paper for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: Got this at a great price for this water resistant paper. I use it to print out geocaching log sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lang

product_meta.title: Rite in the Rain All-Weather Copier Paper, 8 1/2" x 11", 20# White, 200 Sheet Pack (No. 8511)
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteCopy or laser print your own all-weather forms, charts, maps, and worksheets on patented Rite in the Rain All-Weather Copier Paper. Have the convenience of using your existing data sheets on a paper that can survive in any weather condition. For pennies a sheet, Rite in the Rain enables you to work efficiently, regardless of the environment. Paper is 20# bond weight. Completely recyclable wood-based paper. Copy or laser print both sides. Not for inkjet printers.
feature_bullets: WEATHERPROOF PAPER: 200 sheets of white 20# Copy Paper per pack. This paper that won’t turn to mush when wet and will repel water, sweat, grease, mud, and even survive the accidental laundry mishap and more.
WHAT TO WRITE WITH: Use a Pencil or All-Weather Pen and your notes will stay intact. Standard Ballpoint pens will work when paper is dry. Water-based inks will bead off Rite in the Rain sheets.
PRINTING: Unlike synthetics, Rite in the Rain won't collect a static charge while printing and duplexing and there is no risk of melting in your machine.
RECYCLABILITY: In spite of Rite in the Rain's durability, it is completely recyclable. Simply recycle Rite in the Rain as you do other white or printed papers.

COPY / LASER PRINT: Print your own forms, charges, maps, worksheets, and other important documents on Rite in the Rain Copy Paper. Unlink other synthetics, Rite in the Rain won't wash or rub off in harsh conditions. NOT FOR INKJET PRINTERS.
